intro: Lotononis delicatula, commonly known as the slender lotonon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
